newsitem.title: HONG KONG: Sino Land raises funds for properties.
newsitem.headline: Sino Land raises funds for properties.

text.p: Sino Land Co Ltd said on Tuesday its proposed US$130 million issue of convertible bonds due 2002 would raise funds for the purchase and development of properties in Hong Kong.
The property group said it proposed to issue not less than US$130 million in bonds convertible into company shares at an initial conversion price of HK$8.50 each, subject to adjustment.

The company said the net proceeds of the issue would be used for working capital and to finance the acquisition and development of further properties in Hong Kong, including the acquisition of a plot of land in Siu Sai Wan in Chai Wan.
Assuming full conversion of the bonds, a total 118.51 million new shares or 3.78 percent of the enlarged share capital, will be issued, it said.
The bonds, to be redeemed on April 18, 2002, will be issued at par and bear interest of 4.00 percent annually. Application will be made to list the bonds in Luxemoburg, the statement.
Sino Land and its chairman's family jointly bought the Chai Wan site for HK$11.82 billion at a government land auction last month.
Sino Land shares ended Monday HK$0.20 lower at HK$7.25.
